result.execSummary:
The defendant Izola Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

-Provide for DNA and pay all costs.
CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO APPLY TO ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS.

No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent or ocurt has approved contact.
Comply with all Children's Court orders.

Successfully complete  Anger Management, and continued programming.
PARENTING CLASSES.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes:
02-12-16/ Judge Michelle Havas
Defendant is non-compliant with the conditions of Probation.
The Court ordered the defendant taken into custody to spend  3 days, Straight Time, with NO Good Time credit, as condition time in the HOC. 

Stayed pending a review on 12-11-2015 at 1:15 pm.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Izola Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Amended JOC reflects 02-12-16 Court order imposing    3  days of condition time

Defendant Izola Smith in court with attorney Gregory Renden for Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 3 days of the condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.

Defendant Izola Smith in court with attorney Gregory Allan Renden.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation, however,  agent  is requesting another review.  Additional review set for 2-12-2016 at 1:15pm  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Izola Smith in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties.
Defendant sentenced to serve 12 months in the House of Correction with credit for 6 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 24 months.
*
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 12-11-2015 at 1:15pm.
-Successfully complete  Anger Management, and continued programming.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate. PARENTING CLASSES.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent or ocurt has approved contact.  Comply with all Children's Court orders.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
-Provide for DNA and pay all costs.
CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO APPLY TO ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS.
Defendant advised as a convicted felon may not carry or possess firearms or body armor and civil rights are suspended until restored.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-19-2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Izola Smith in court with Attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Molly Schmidt, appearing for Abbey Marie DeSiato, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and enters a judgment of conviction.

Court advises defendant that all conditions of bail remain as previously set.  Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 4.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.
No PSI ordered.
Clerk:  jms

JusticePoint Pretrial Report dated July 1, 2015 received and filed.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Izola Smith in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for Plea Hearing in Branch 4 on 7-2-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, until further order of the Court.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

Defendant Izola Smith in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
This is a co-defendant case with (2015CF1782).
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Danilo Cardenas.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Available discovery turned over to defense counsel, including an offer letter, per the State.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-3-2015 at 1:30 pm.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Melissa H. or DP (dob 12-16-03), cooperate with Justice Point and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

15RM022464  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04/27/2015
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: Co-Defendant Melissa Hartfield; DP (dob: 12/16/2003)
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Izola Smith in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Izola Smith in custody.  
Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. 

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
